definition: real scene (not set up or posed)/real location (not a film studio set or theater)/live action (not animation)

sentences.english: Some people think that as long as the real Bangshui lake.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为只要实景傍水临湖。

sentences.english: A landscape spectacle was premiered in Xibaipo, Hebei Province on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 周二一场大型实景演出在河北省西柏坡首次上演。

sentences.english: During the World Cup in Germany in photo shoot.
sentences.chinese: 影片在德国世界杯期间实景拍摄。

sentences.english: Two large dioramas at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口处两处规模宏大的实景模型。

sentences.english: To do this, it clearly shows the formation of the real landscape painting style.
sentences.chinese: 以便更清晰的展现萧云从实景山水画风格之形成过程。

sentences.english: Because it can't be film in the real place.
sentences.chinese: 因为有些影片不能在实景拍摄。

definition: rendering (visual representation of how things will turn out)
bird's-eye view/see also 俯瞰圖|俯瞰图[fu3 kan4 tu2]
bird's-eye view/see also 鳥瞰圖|鸟瞰图[niao3 kan4 tu2]
a plan/a planar graph/a plane figure
candid photograph/genuine photograph (not set up or doctored)
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
the feeling that sth is genuine/sense of reality/in the flesh
to restore to the original state/to reconstruct (an event)/reduction (chemistry)
